citations.narrative:
The facility has exceeded the maximum number of animals allowed on their license. The license has authorized up to 250
animals and the facility currently has 259 animals. The USDA license authorizes a specific number of animals to ensure
that the facility and personnel possess adequate facilities, employees and education to provide sufficient husbandry to the
regulated animals.
A licensee must obtain a new license before any change resulting in more than the authorized number of animals on hand
at any single point in time during the period of licensure. Correct by 7 January 2026, by either reapplying for a license that
properly reflects the number of regulated animals on the property or reduce the number of regulated animals to a number
which is under the maximum threshold authorized under the current license.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Several enclosures are not being cleaned frequently enough, leading to an excessive accumulation of excreta. Three
enclosures, housing a total of 17 pigeons have large accumulations of excreta, specifically in the nesting boxes. The
waste piles occupy the majority of the floor of the nesting boxes, leaving only a few areas for nesting. Accumulation of
feces and excreta can lead to increased disease hazards or illnesses. Correct by ensuring excreta is removed from
primary enclosures and from under and around primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent excessive
accumulation of feces, to prevent soiling of the birds contained in the primary enclosures, and to reduce disease hazards,
insects, pests, and odors.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.1(b)(2)(i) 
   
Requirements and application 
The facility has exceeded the maximum number of animals allowed on their license. The license has authorized up to 250 
animals and the facility currently has 259 animals. The USDA license authorizes a specific number of animals to ensure 
that the facility and personnel possess adequate facilities, employees and education to provide sufficient husbandry to the 
regulated animals. 
 
A licensee must obtain a new license before any change resulting in more than the authorized number of animals on hand 
at any single point in time during the period of licensure. Correct by 7 January 2026, by either reapplying for a license that 
properly reflects the number of regulated animals on the property or reduce the number of regulated animals to a number 
which is under the maximum threshold authorized under the current license. 
3.158(a)(1)  Repeat
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Several enclosures are not being cleaned frequently enough, leading to an excessive accumulation of excreta. Three 
enclosures, housing a total of 17 pigeons have large accumulations of excreta, specifically in the nesting boxes. The 
waste piles occupy the majority of the floor of the nesting boxes, leaving only a few areas for nesting. Accumulation of 
feces and excreta can lead to increased disease hazards or illnesses. Correct by ensuring excreta is removed from 
primary enclosures and from under and around primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent excessive 
accumulation of feces, to prevent soiling of the birds contained in the primary enclosures, and to reduce disease hazards, 
insects, pests, and odors. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
